reviewText:
This hidden object game looks like clipart literally threw up, different styles of drawings mixed in as if thrown together in a mix mash.  Some items are photos for example and others are like drawn cartoons with no rhyme or reason.   Worst part of the game is the game itself.   Often items will be stuck behind items maybe showing like one pixel of the actual hidden object.

Playfirst makes alot of great puzzle games from NIghtshift to Valerie Porter which would be better suggestions to get your puzzle finding fix.

Rating:  0/10  Value:  $0.00
voteText: 18 of 23 people (78%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
It is a great game - in fact, one of only few 'hidden objects' casual games I was able to play :)
But then I am a big fan of DinerTown adventures like 'Avenue Flo'. And here we not only meet Flo herself and all her friends, but we actually play as Bernie, one of the most memorable DinerTown characters, who tries to be a detective. And that means - not only just plain hidden-objects-searching, but quite a lot of other diverse puzzles as well!

The only drawback of this game is that unfortunately PlayFirst has abandoned PC market for several years already and they are no longer with us to support their great games. Which means - no trading cards, no achievements, no Steam sales, no updates - and many negative reviews from people who couldn't launch the game for some reason.
And I have to add that I had no trouble launching and running it with all the videos on my rather new PC.

reviewText: I had a great time playing this with my wife. It's a hidden object game with a few more puzzles thrown in, all framed around the short-term goals of solving silly mysteries. It's very well made and very pleasant.

reviewText: Felt like writing a positive review for this game. I had quite some fun with the colorful scenes and the references the game has to the Diner Dash series. After a couple of levels, obviously you've kind of seen everything gameplay-wise, but I don't hold that against casual games like this. It had enough variety in it to keep me interested to the end, and I'd recommend it to fans of hidden object games and/or Diner Dash.\n\nP.S.: I had no technical issues whatsoever, and tried it on my desktop PC, my own laptop and someone else's laptop.
